item.description:
Hi thought I'd let you in on a great party, I go every year it is the Seacoast's longest-running annual Halloween Party featuring dancing, apparitions, value-priced cocktails and the Jumbo Circus Peanuts which is set for Saturday, October 27, at the Portsmouth VFW Ballroom, 238 Deer Street, downtown. Doors open at 8 p.m. for the over-21 show. Tickets are $10, no advance sale. The theme for this year's party is "Zombie Ice Capades."

In recognition of its historic twelfth Halloween party, the band is offering several special promotions. Patrons who bring a copy of this article with them to the door will receive a $3 ticket discount. And, guests who purchase 12 drinks at the same time will receive a free drink on the band. "We call it our 13-for-12 drink special," said two-time band spokesmodel Whitey Brown, a clarinetist and vocalist. (Offer subject to state and local regulations and other restrictions may apply.)

Brown also explained this year's party theme. "We chose Zombie Ice Capades as this year's theme for obvious reasons," she said. "The real Ice Capades has been dead for years now but we feel strongly that we might be able to bring it back. We're also hoping that a lot of partygoers will dress like a zombie Dorothy Hamill or Scott Hamilton and dance the night away in their ice skates."

Brown pointed out that zombie figure skaters attending the party must wear blade guards at all times to avoid marring the polished parquet floor at the VFW ballroom. "That policy will be strictly enforced," she said. She added, "You don't absolutely have to dress like a zombie Ice Capades star, but we will be awarding prizes to the best Dick Buttons, Peggy Fleming, and the Shipstads and Johnson." She also quickly pointed out the band embraces zombie diversity and welcomes the undead and other Halloween characters of any background or persuasion.

The Jumbo Circus Peanuts are a 10-piece party band with an eclectic repertoire of pop, funk, Motown, R&B, jazz, Latin, and exotic tunes. Styled in the manner of a New Orleans brass band, the Peanuts? distinctive carnival-style dances are well-known at the band?s self-proclaimed ?international headquarters,? the Portsmouth VFW. In addition to an ample dance floor the venue offers ringside seating in a nightclub atmosphere, a cocktail buffet, clean rest rooms, complimentary parking on-site and is smoke-free.
For more information visit jumbocircuspeanuts.com.

So join us in a wild night of great music and awsome costumes, look for the monster monkey dancing to the monster music! see you there. Peter
